pic1_alt: Smaller towns have the highest average educational attainment. A plot of educational attanment index scores for English towns, ranging from about -10 to 12. Each town is represented by a dot, and the dots are faceted into five size groups: small towns, medium towns, large towns, cities (excluding London), and London. The average attainment for cities is around -2.5, with average attainment increasing by group size, with small towns having the highest average attainment, just above 0.
pic2_alt: Small towns are less likely to be classed as having high income deprivation. A plot of income deprivation groups by town size in England. 100% of cities are classified as having higher income deprivation, with about 25% of small towns classified as having higher income deprivation.
